ovdesc.p: This application allow user to define a target weight allocation (asset Allocation). Matrix are define
with one (e.g.: SECTOR) or two axis (e.g.: ASSET/CURRENCY).
For each cell, at the crossing of the abscissa and the ordinate, a model target weight and a tolerance variation are set. Each cell can contain a link to another matrix.

desc.p: Defines the priority of X-axis members.
Validations:

p.p: Mandatory input field, when the system is prioritised to do rebalancing. This is based on the matrix priority defined in X axis.
No additional members can be defined in the priority fields, i.e. only those members which are defined in the matrix can have a priority.
Does not accept any other members in these fields.
All the members which are defined along the X axis must have a priority, if the system is prioritised for rebalancing based on matrix priority.

desc.p: Define nature of each cell. Depending of the nature of cell, rebalancing tool have different process to generate proposed orders.
Blank : Rebalancing tool doesn't process this cell.
MOD : "Model portfolio" Rebalancing tool get directly the security set for this cell. Assign to cell who define exactly the security.
RCD : "Recommendation" Rebalancing tool used recommended stock list to proposed orders. Assign to cells who securities with criteria (asset, currency, industry sector ...).
TGHT : "Through" Rebalancing tool used linked matrix to rebalance the portfolio. NOT AVAILABLE
CCY : Rebalancing tool generate FX spot transactions for each cell defined as CCY.
PIVOT : Defined the pivot currency when rebalancing generate FX spot orders.
HDG : Rebalancing tool generate FX forward transactions for each cell defined as HDG.
Only MOD, RCD, TGHT can be entered.
Cannot be set on a total cell. A total cell cannot be rebalance. (see User Guide)
For TGHT option, a linked matrix must be set.
For CCY option a PIVOT cell must be set.
